entries.title: XBB.1.5: Still more questions than answers on risk of latest omicron subvariant
entries.description: Amid heightened concern, XBB.1.5 risks have a "high degree of uncertainty."

entries.title: Microsoft will start firmly pushing Xbox owners toward energy-saving mode
entries.description: Xboxes will soon have options for active hours and carbon-friendly downloads.

entries.title: Hundreds of SugarCRM servers infected with critical in-the-wild exploit
entries.description: Attackers are using the exploit to infect on-premises servers with web shell backdoors.

entries.title: Microsoft 365 Basic gives you 100GB of OneDrive space (but no Office) for $2
entries.description: Basic subscription tier will also remove ads from web and mobile Outlook apps.

entries.title: Chuck E. Cheese still uses floppy disks in 2023, but not for long
entries.description: Employee TikTok reveals a floor show upgrade from floppy and DVD—possibly for the last time.

entries.title: TCL backtracks on making its first OLED TVs
entries.description: QD-OLED announcement during CES was apparently a mistake.

entries.title: Twitter didn’t block child sex abuse hashtags until journalists pointed them out
entries.description: Hashtags promoting sale of CSAM were searchable on Twitter until NBC News report.

entries.title: RPG fans irate as D&D tries to shut its “open” game license
entries.description: Leaked document seeks to revoke two decades of royalty-free rules sharing.

entries.title: A widespread logic controller flaw raises the specter of Stuxnet
entries.description: Over 120 PLC models contain a serious vulnerability—and no fix is on the way.

entries.title: Nothing Phone’s US “beta test” targets people with more money than sense
entries.description: For $300, you won't get US cellular bands, a warranty, or a production OS.

entries.title: Oddities in nuclear reactor measurements not due to a new particle
entries.description: An anomaly in neutrino measurements is real, but the cause isn't a new neutrino.

entries.title: Parler reportedly axed most of its staff after ending deal to sell to Kanye West
entries.description: "Free speech" social network reportedly laid off most of its executives, too.

entries.title: Hackers discover that vulnerabilities are rife in the auto industry
entries.description: Connected car skeptics have a right to be concerned about the widespread problem.

entries.title: Report: Apple is developing its own in-house Micro LED displays
entries.description: Screens said to ship in Apple Watch first, with iPhone and others to follow.

entries.title: Madden NFL 23 removing faux-CPR celebration after Damar Hamlin collapse
entries.description: Staging a cardiac arrest scene is too much, too soon, even for Madden.

entries.title: Russia will abandon Soyuz on orbit, fly up a new one to bring crew home
entries.description: The temperature inside the vehicle could reach the low 40s Celsius during Earth return.

entries.title: With Business Connect, Apple escalates its competition with Google Maps
entries.description: Businesses can now customize the place cards seen in Maps and search results.

entries.title: Iran to use facial recognition to identify women without hijabs
entries.description: Iranian official says algorithms can identify anyone flouting dress codes.

entries.title: Flights grounded nationwide as FAA’s notice system suffers outage
entries.description: The notices warn pilots of potential hazards along their routes.

entries.title: A fifth of passwords used by federal agency cracked in security audit
entries.description: 89 percent of the department's high-value assets had easy-to-crack passcodes.
